meanings.definition: Situated on or affecting the opposite side of the body.
meanings.sent1: The contralateral arm felt numb after the injection.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the contralateral leg for comparison.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her contralateral hand had a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: The contralateral side of the road seemed brighter in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The contralateral eye blinked in surprise.

meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting the side of the body opposite to that on which a particular structure or condition occurs.
meanings.sent1: The contralateral ear was unaffected by the loud noise.
meanings.sent2: He pointed to the contralateral hip where the pain originated.
meanings.sent3: The contralateral foot seemed to have a dance of its own.
meanings.sent4: Her contralateral shoulder carried the weight of responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The contralateral nostril twitched at the strong scent.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the opposite side of the body.
meanings.sent1: The contralateral side of his face showed a different expression.
meanings.sent2: She massaged the contralateral hand to improve circulation.
meanings.sent3: The contralateral knee decided to bend on its own.
meanings.sent4: His contralateral foot tapped to the rhythm of the music.
meanings.sent5: The contralateral toe wiggled in response to the tickle.
